newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Polar Amsterdam-Dubai-Delhi flight starts Feb 17.
newsitem.headline: Polar Amsterdam-Dubai-Delhi flight starts Feb 17.

text.p: Polar Air will launch its new freighter service ex-Schiphol to the Middle East and India on February 17, a spokesman of Inter Aviation Services said.
The U.S. all-cargo airline will operate the twice-weekly service with a Boeing 747 freighter, he added.
Inter Aviation is the airline's general sales agent of Polar Air in the Netherlands.
Polar Air's scheduled outbound calls are New York- Amsterdam-Dubai-Delhi but on the return-leg the carrier also flies to London, before returning to New York.
Departures are scheduled from Amsterdam on Tuesdays and Sundays, said the spokesman.

Several Dutch forwarders sources said they are interested in the cargo rates the U.S. carrier will be offering, following the announcement by KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV Cargo that rises will be introduced in March in the Amsterdam-India market.

KLM stated that it will implement rises of between 20-30 percent to the Indian sub-continent. Air India is expected to follow with a similar rise, industry sources said. Currently the rate to India is hovering between Fl 2.20-2.25 Dutch guilders.
Polar also has flights from Amsterdam to New York, with connections on to Australia, New Zealand and Latin America. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44-171-542-7706 Fax+5017
